original: DAHL.BERG, Erik Adolf, Generalkonsul, Stockholm, f Sthlm 21/6 80 av boktr.förest G D o Alma Lindeström, gm Tora Wallborg. Efter avsl skolg prakt å tekn avd v tidn- o boktryckerier. Anst AB Nyqvarn 09, tryck.-mtrlfma C F Strömbäck 10—16, start 16 fma f tryck.maskiner, stilar, utensilier o finpapper en gros. Gen.konsul f Salvador sed 35. Ordf Frn 80 års män, munskänk Sthlm-Gillet, skattm Wennerbergssällsk, medl i ytterl ett 50-t frnar o sällsk. Resor: Tyskl ett 20-t ggr, Engl, Frankr, Schweiz, Österr, Ung, Tjeckoslov, Ryssl, Finl, Holl, Belg, Norge, Danm v fi tillf. Av trycket: Festskr m anledn av f mång 25-årsjub (tills m fi medarb). RVO,RiksdJubBM, Nat.insaml:s 35 Ht. Hobbies: Ordens- o frnsliv, sång, musik, teater. Erik Dahlberg representerar Maschinenfabr Johannisberg, Geisenheim A/Rhein, vilken bygger tryckpressar, o Bauer’sche Giesserei, Frankf A/Main, ett av världens största stil-gjuterier, och ett flertal andra fabriker.
translated: DAHL.BERG, Erik Adolf, Consul General, Stockholm, b. Stockholm 21/6 80, son of book printer manager G D and Alma Lindeström, m. Tora Wallborg. After completing school, practical training in the technical department of newspapers and printing companies. Employed at AB Nyqvarn from 1909, printing materials firm C F Strömbäck 1910-1916, established own business in 1916 selling printing machines, styles, utensils, and fine paper wholesale. Consul General for El Salvador since 1935. Chairman of the Frn 80-year-old men's society, maître d' for the Stockholm-Gillet, treasurer of Wennerbergssällsk, member of several associations and societies. Has traveled to Germany around 20 times, as well as England, France, Switzerland, Austria, Hungary, Czechoslovakia, Russia, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Norway, and Denmark, on numerous occasions. Published commemorative writings for the 25th anniversary of many occasions (together with several collaborators). Recipient of the Royal Order of the Vasa, recipient of the Riksdag Jubilee Medal, and has contributed to the National Fund's 35th Collection. Hobbies include participating in orders and societies, singing, music, and theatre. Erik Dahlberg represents Maschinenfabr Johannisberg, Geisenheim A/Rhein, which manufactures printing presses, as well as Bauer'sche Giesserei, Frankf A/Main, one of the world's largest style foundries, among other factories.
